summary:
As a real tech enthusiast always looking for the 'best fit', not only technical but also economical and sustainable. Working accurate, step by step through the design process and analyze the progress still meets (business) criteria. Keeping the eye on the ball, but not loosing the bigger picture (budget, manufacturability, maintainability, sustainable, company vision and strategy).

Enjoying matching work with members’ skills, knowledge and interests. Encouraging the exchange of knowledge for mutual understanding and a stronger (team) base. "Knowledge leads to Power, Sharing leads to Strength".

projects:
[{'title': 'Linux / uboot redesign', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'description': 'For migration from a MMU-less system (vendor specific core) to a MMU system it was my task to design a new system architecture with the key requirements
- low production risk (stock shortage)
- applicable for our complete product series
- modular for future implementations & addons

For the linux environment the ARMv8 Cortex A53 was the most logic choice, recent (standard) arm core and available at atleast three vendors in almost identical SOC architectures. Also, a latest Vanilla 64bit linux kernel could be used (not vendor bound).

By moving our custom (u-boot) bare-metal code to (user) applications and kernel modules / device-drivers we have the ability to expose different underlying devices in an uniform way to our (user) application layer. Also the critical (kernel) code blocks are small and isolated which increases test-ability and maintainability. Because the device-driver depend on (dynamically linked) platform drivers the software becomes portable between different vendor specific hardware.

With a uniform and flexible platform we have the ability to release features and updates for ALL product series at once and reduce time for testing, maintenance, development and integration.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'tjarco', 'last_name': 'boerkoel', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technical lead R&D'}]}, {'title': 'Active house A++++', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'description': 'A++++ energy rated home heated by a single 3KW VWS36/4 heatpump (DHW+heating/cooling). Energy efficient with only a single phase 40A grid connection.
With 12kWpeak solar generation resulting in an annual negative energy bill (building + user consumption) of -1200kWh.
The environment (heating, lights, media, intrusion, load balancing, etc) is controlled and monitored by OpenHab which is running in a Virtual Machine on a MS2019std Cluster (iSCSI, cluster aware updates).

The project will be expanded by 40kWh battery storage & managed by a single SMA Island inverter.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'tjarco', 'last_name': 'boerkoel', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technical lead R&D'}]}, {'title': 'IT migration', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'description': 'Selection of external IT partners, design of new infrastructure, validation of price quote and project plan, progress monitoring and communication stakeholders.

- Migration of existing services (novel / groupwise) 
- Replacement of linux servers by new windows 2019 failover cluster infrastructure. 
- Migration of Novel/Groupwise to Active Directory and 365cloud
- Migrate services virtualized to new windows 2019 cluster infrastructure (Hyper-v).
- Isolate risky departments (testing, repair, development, administration) and (core) infrastructure by using VLANs and routing policies.
- Network infrastructure considerations: router load (keep cluster and replication data at L2), failover and balancing (aggregation).', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'tjarco', 'last_name': 'boerkoel', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technical lead R&D'}]}, {'title': '150KW PV-simulation with 10x SM1500-CP-30', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'description': 'As R&D engineer I've engineered the PV-simulater for the SM15K series. This includes (linux) applications, interfacing, mathematics, simulation, embedded system engineering, interfacing (SPI/SCI),  and HMI (web based interface). 
Because of the flexible implementation of the system control (loop) and the Master-Slafe interface I was able to integrate this as an "add-on", making it scalable in combination with the Master-Slave option. 

I've tested the PV-simulation successfully on a 150KW PV-simulation stack (10x 15KW  SM1500-CP-30) and a SMA 150KW 'PEAK3' solar inverter.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'tjarco', 'last_name': 'boerkoel', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technical lead R&D'}]}, {'title': 'SM15K Application simulations', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'description': "Designed, implemented and tested a realtime simulation engine for the SM15K series which can run several simulations next to the digital control loop, like 'leadless sensing, internal resistance, function generator, etc.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'tjarco', 'last_name': 'boerkoel', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technical lead R&D'}]}, {'title': 'SM15K Master Slave 900KW (up to 60units)', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'description': "For the SM15K series it was my Job to research and development an 'master-slave' interface being able to build power-stacks. Main goal was to retain the dynamic performance as much as possible and to have the dynamic performance uniform, regardless of the number of units in the system.
This is achieved by creating a high speed DMA controlled daisychain and a multidrop bus.
The result is a scalable setup from 2 to 60 units (900kW) with uniform dynamic and static performance for all unit types.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'tjarco', 'last_name': 'boerkoel', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technical lead R&D'}]}, {'title': 'SM15K - digital control', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'For the SM15K series it was my responsibility to design and implement an embedded system architecture for high resolution and high speed data acquisition on a multi-core microcontroller. 
For the DC-powerstages I designed and implemented a realtime high bandwidth system control (loop) and multi-converter current balancing mechanism. Also the design and implementation of several  power converter protections, system startup self-tests and production testing was my responsibility.
This includes the design of hardware in schematic and PCB editor and verification by using equipment as scope. Also the design of and integration of interfacing and HMI was my part of responsibility.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'tjarco', 'last_name': 'boerkoel', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technical lead R&D'}]}, {'title': 'Embedded linux & uboot', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'description': 'Designed, implemented and tested several applications in u-boot and uClinux.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'tjarco', 'last_name': 'boerkoel', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technical lead R&D'}]}, {'title': 'SM3300 - 1&3phase PFC', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'description': 'Research, design and implementation a software defined Power Factor Correction, based on a C2000 MCU.
- Data acquisition, control loop, protections (over current, current trip, power limit, temperature limit).
- Design and implementation of C/ASM embedded software (interfacing, communication protocols, debugging, interrupts)
- Build of test setup (power conversion, Labview GUI)
- Hardware testing, design verification and debugging', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'tjarco', 'last_name': 'boerkoel', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technical lead R&D'}]}]
